Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/n06k4ai5851r2vamw8m86a59i9x1rxxi-findutils-4.10.0 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A findutils https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/9bc39f4df570caf2f55bada656ac4d92c06e5b2d.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/9bc39f4df570caf2f55bada656ac4d92c06e5b2d#findutils

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/n06k4ai5851r2vamw8m86a59i9x1rxxi-findutils-4.10.0
ls -la /nix/store/n06k4ai5851r2vamw8m86a59i9x1rxxi-findutils-4.10.0/bin

items.title: Add nixos-needsreboot to NixOS

items.content_html:
Prior to this commit, the default behaviour of services.openssh is to set the cryptographic algorithms to those recommended by Mozilla and a blog post.

This option allows users to easily opt-opt ouf of this recommendation and instead use upstream's defaults.

I'm also open to just dropping any overriding of upstream's defaults. In future I'll be exploring switching this default to false.

Description of changes

items.title: nixos/ssh: introduce enableRecommendedAlgorithms

items.content_html:
Description of changes

We would like to have the @NixOS/acme team assigned for review to changes of this module.

Rationale is that changes to ACME module need to be carefully reviewed as breaking changes can be quite high-impact for end-users.

See e.g.: #270221 (comment)

Note that I need a github admin to set up permissions for us as I currently get the following error:

Unknown owner on line 107: make sure the team @NixOS/acme exists, is publicly visible, and has write access to the repository

items.title: CODEOWNERS: add @NixOS/acme

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This PR moves the existing Prometheus test to just being a Thanos test, whilst adding more test cases specific to Prometheus itself:

  • Alertmanager
  • Federation
  • Pushgateway
  • Remote write

Also adds a alertmanager-webhook-logger package+module so that the Alertmanager test can be end-to-end.

items.title: nixos/radicle: init services

items.content_html:
Description of changes

I've noticed some that some values are not set using mkDefault, especially in case where values differ between the different parts of netbird. This happens for example when only using the nginx for the dashboard while the rest is using another host as a reverse proxy.
Another thing that is kinda suboptimal is the Stun and Turn config. Since they are using lists, they may not merge as expected, meaning they don't merge at all currenly. I've not yet found a way how to make this both easy to setup, with good defaults, while also allowing changes, without having to redefine the whole list.
Lastly, I put acme in a mkIf since otherwise the attrset will be empty but exist, which fails some assertions in the acme module.

I've added myself as a maintainer since I plan to keep using this module and would like to help keep it updated, but I'm not hard on that if you want to skip the hassle of multiple maintainers, that's fine by me.

Things done

items.title: nixos/espanso: fix espanso options

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Closes: #315158

podman provides a systemd-user-generator binary that is named quadlet.
This binary should be made available in systemd's search path (/etc/systemd/user-generators), which we don't currently link and the PR is aiming at changing that, effecting in podman rootless quadlet containers to start working.

I wonder if I should split this PR 🤔.

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
